interactions.content:
Capybaras (Hydrochoerus hydrochaeris) are native to South America and are typically found in a variety of habitats, primarily near water sources. They inhabit regions such as grasslands, savannas, and tropical rainforests. Capybaras are highly adaptable animals and are commonly found in low-lying areas around rivers, lakes, ponds, and marshes.

Their range includes several countries in South America, most notably Brazil, Venezuela, Colombia, Argentina, and Paraguay. Because they are semi-aquatic, they rely on water for their survival and are often seen swimming or submerged to evade predators.

References:
- Capybara - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capybara
- Hydrochoerinae - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrochoerinae
